WorkItem.Description:
Hi,
I have an unhandled null pointer exception in Line 351 of FibonacciHeap.cs:  if (deletingNode || (priorityComparsion(NewKey, next.Priority) * DirectionMultiplier) < 0).
In file bug.7z (compressed with GNU 7Zip, http://www.7-zip.org/, please let me know if it's a problem, I'll install something else ) there is both the self contained project as well as a jpeg snip of the visual studio 2010 debugger window stopped with the exception, together with the locals and the stack. There is no problem when Prim is changed to Kruskal.
 
The project referencing QuickGraph is written in F#, the graph here was built trivially by just adding vertices and edges, not using the delegates. Please let me know if some clarifications/tests are needed.
 
Thanks,
Vladimir
WorkItem.Summary: Unhandled Null Pointer Exception in Line 351 of FibonacciHeap.cs

Comments.Message: Could you attach the source code instead of a zip?
I made a self contained test case. To build it just create an F# project (in VS 2010 Beta 1+) with this file and add quickgraph.dll as a reference.
I looked, after my simplifications the graph remained with just two vertices. Could the issue be related to the fact that the graph is not simple?

Hi Jonathan,
I noticed here that if I enforce that no parallel edges are added, everything works fine.
Ha parralel edges. That's a good hint.
